nodes.bodyText: Usually when the code is simple enough, we try to keep one file for both compliant and noncompliant examples.
This formatting looks strange, is it intended? Same for the next MethodMatchers.

I tend to agree that reporting only one issue per test file is enough, we should just make sure that the rspec description reflects this behavior (current Highlighting part mention that one issue per method will be reported).

If you call this method naively with any Tree, the cast is not safe.
I would rather use NewClassTree as parameter's type and perform the cast when you call it.
Same for checkAndReportUUIDRandomUsage.

It means that we will report an issue for Random with seed.
Not so unpredictable, but using hardcoded value is still more readable, so it seems correct to me.
We should just add a test for this case, to show that we thought about it.
Can it actually take parameters? If not, we should consider using addWithoutParametersMatcher().
I don't think it makes sense to include the main location in the secondaries.

commit.message: Remove the first usage from secondary locations

beforeCommit.message: Remove the first usage from secondary locations

afterCommit.message: Remove the first usage from secondary locations
